name: noctalia-shell
description: A sleek and minimal desktop shell thoughtfully crafted for Wayland.
readme_summary: Noctalia Shell is a minimal and customizable desktop shell for Wayland compositors. It's built on Quickshell and designed to be lightweight and easily adaptable to different user styles, with native support for compositors like Niri, Hyprland, Sway, and MangoWC.
key_features: Native support for Niri, Hyprland, Sway and MangoWC
primary_use_case: Providing a customizable and minimal desktop environment for Wayland compositors.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a serene, futuristic cityscape where customizable building blocks represent different desktop elements. A central control panel, glowing with lavender hues, allows a user to rearrange and personalize these blocks, creating their ideal desktop layout. Digital threads connect the control panel to each block, symbolizing the underlying Quickshell framework. Small screens embedded in the buildings display snippets of QML code, hinting at the shell's customization options. The scene is bathed in soft, ambient light with a clean, focused composition. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and crisp details.

name: gdrive
readme_summary: gdrive is a command-line application written in Rust for interacting with Google Drive. It allows users to manage their Google Drive files and accounts directly from the terminal. While it's a successor to gdrive2, it currently implements only basic functionality.
key_features: Command-line interface for Google Drive interaction
primary_use_case: Managing Google Drive files and accounts from the command line, particularly useful for scripting and automation.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously organizing digital files into a giant, glowing Google Drive cloud archive. The librarian uses a command-line interface projected onto a holographic screen to categorize and upload documents. Small digital particles representing data flow from physical documents into the cloud. The scene is set in a futuristic library with warm, inviting lighting. Small UI elements showing file names and folder structures are subtly visible. The composition is clean and focused with a blue and white color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: termusic
description: Music Player TUI written in Rust
readme_summary: Termusic is a terminal-based music and podcast player written in Rust. It aims to provide a free and open-source alternative to online streaming services, allowing users to play locally stored audio files and download content from platforms like YouTube, NetEase, Migu, and KuGou.
key_features: Support for various audio formats (MP4, MP3, OGG, FLAC, WAV, etc.)
Support for multiple backends (Rusty, MPV, Gstreamer)
Free music download from YouTube, NetEase, Migu and KuGou
primary_use_case: Playing music and podcasts from the terminal, with support for local files and downloads from online sources.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled DJ stands at a futuristic console, transforming sound waves into vibrant, tangible musical notes that float into the air. The console displays a terminal interface with the termusic logo subtly integrated. The DJ is surrounded by glowing speakers that pulse with the rhythm. The scene is set in a minimalist studio with soft, ambient lighting. Small UI elements on the console show audio waveforms and playback controls. The composition is clean and focused with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: whitebox
description: whitebox is a Prometheus exporter that provides availability monitoring of external VPN services powered by VMESS, VLESS, TROJAN, WireGuard and Shadowsocks.
readme_summary: The whitebox repository provides a Prometheus exporter for monitoring the availability of external VPN services. It supports various VPN protocols like VMESS, VLESS, Trojan, WireGuard, and Shadowsocks, exposing probe results as Prometheus metrics for comprehensive VPN tunnel health monitoring.
key_features: Multi-protocol VPN Probing (VMESS, VLESS, Trojan, Wireguard, Shadowsocks)
RESTful API Service for on-demand connectivity checks
Custom Probe Configuration (connection details, target URLs, timeouts)
primary_use_case: Monitoring the availability and performance of external VPN services using Prometheus.
cover_image_prompt: A lighthouse stands tall on a rocky coast, its beam shining through a network of colorful, interconnected tunnels representing VPN connections. The lighthouse represents 'whitebox', diligently monitoring the tunnels. Some tunnels are brightly lit, indicating healthy connections, while others are dim or broken, signaling issues. Small digital screens are embedded in the rocks, displaying Prometheus metrics and VPN protocol icons. The scene is set at twilight with a dramatic sky. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear details and a cool color palette.

name: free-proxy
description: Free proxy scraper written in python. It is pypi library - free to use.
readme_summary: The `free-proxy` Python library scrapes free proxies from various websites, checks their validity, and allows filtering by country and timeout. It provides a simple way to obtain working proxies for use with requests, Selenium, or other applications, returning them as strings.
key_features: Scrapes proxies from multiple websites (sslproxies.org, us-proxy.org, free-proxy-list.net)
Specifies acceptable timeout for proxy connections
Supports anonymous and elite proxy filtering
primary_use_case: Obtaining working proxies for web scraping, bypassing geographical restrictions, or masking IP addresses in various applications.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously cleaning dusty books (proxies) with a specialized vacuum cleaner that filters out damaged pages (non-working proxies). The librarian sorts the cleaned books onto shelves labeled with country codes (US, GB, etc.). A small screen on the librarian's desk displays a real-time connection test to a website. Digital particles representing data flow around the librarian. The library is bathed in soft, focused light. The composition is clean and organized with a warm color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: anytype-ts
description: Official Anytype client for MacOS, Linux, and Windows
readme_summary: Anytype Desktop is a local-first, peer-to-peer, and end-to-end encrypted knowledge OS for macOS, Windows, and Linux. It allows users to gather, connect, and remix all kinds of information, create various content types, and define their own data model while ensuring data privacy and offline accessibility.
key_features: Offline-first, local storage with optional peer-to-peer sync
Composable blocks (text, databases, kanban, calendar & custom Types)
Extensible through gRPC API and AI Agents
Open code under the Any Source Available License 1.0
primary_use_case: Personal knowledge management and secure data storage across devices.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a personal fortress of knowledge, visualized as a grand library filled with interconnected rooms. A scholar, representing the user, stands at the center, seamlessly linking various documents, notes, and media displayed on glowing tablets and interactive screens. Each room is secured by shimmering, encrypted locks, symbolizing the data's privacy. Outside, a network of interconnected nodes represents peer-to-peer syncing. Subtle code snippets and data visualizations float in the air, connecting the library to the digital realm. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light, creating a sense of security and intellectual exploration. The image should be in a detailed 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors.

name: chart_server_dart
description: This project is a simple, high-performance HTTP API built with Dart and the Shelf framework. It dynamically generates and serves customizable bar chart images (PNG format) based on data and optional color configurations passed in a JSON request body.
readme_summary: The chart_server_dart repository provides a simple, high-performance HTTP API for dynamically generating customizable bar chart images (PNG format). Built with Dart and the Shelf framework, it accepts data and color configurations via a JSON request body, offering a REST interface for easy integration.
key_features: Uses the `image` package for efficient image manipulation
primary_use_case: Dynamically generating and serving customizable bar chart images via an HTTP API.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan meticulously crafting a vibrant bar chart from raw data flowing through glowing pipes. The artisan uses a palette of colorful paints to customize the chart's appearance, with digital screens displaying the JSON configuration options. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop filled with subtle tech elements like data streams and UI panels. The repository name, 'Chart Server Dart,' is subtly etched on the artisan's workbench. The composition is clean and focused with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
